children.name: Research Approach

symbols.name: Summary

children.docstring: Visitors form their first impression within **50 milliseconds**. If they don't immediately understand what's being offered and why it matters, they le
children.name: The 50 Millisecond Rule

children.docstring: **55% of visitors leave within 8 seconds** if they don't immediately get "what's in it for me."
children.name: The 8-Second Decision Window

children.docstring: Best-converting landing pages maintain an attention ratio of 1:1 - one page, one goal.
children.name: Attention Ratio 1:1

children.docstring: | Category | Median Conversion Rate | |----------|------------------------| | Online courses | 18.3% | | General courses | 13.0% | | All education | 8
children.name: Industry Conversion Rates

children.docstring: Education landing pages perform best with **363 words or fewer** - the lowest target word count across all industries.
children.name: Word Count Sweet Spot

children.docstring: - Education pages see **6x more traffic from mobile** - But desktop converts **17.6% higher** - 83% of traffic is mobile, but mobile converts 8% lower
children.name: Mobile vs Desktop

children.name: Traffic Source Performance

children.name: CTA Placement Strategy

children.name: Sticky CTA Considerations

children.name: Field Count Impact

children.docstring: - Above-the-fold placement can increase conversions by **94%** - If form can't be above fold, use anchor link from above-fold CTA - Multi-step forms c
children.name: Form Placement

children.docstring: - Single-column layout for linear path - Large touch targets (44px minimum) - Real-time inline validation - Minimize typing (use dropdowns, auto-compl
children.name: Mobile Form Best Practices

children.docstring: - Red buttons got **21-34% more clicks** than green in some tests - BUT: There's no universal "best color" - **The real rule:** CTA must be in STARK C
children.name: Color & Contrast

children.name: CTA Copy That Converts

children.name: CTA Placement Density

children.name: Types and Effectiveness

children.docstring: - **Don't hide at bottom** - use social proof near CTAs and at friction points - Place metrics (student count, success rate) in hero or near pricing -
children.name: Strategic Placement

children.docstring: | Signal | Impact | |--------|--------| | Payment badges (Visa, etc) | +81% purchase likelihood | | Money-back guarantee | +32% sales (VWO study) | |
children.name: Trust Signals That Convert

children.docstring: For tutoring (high commitment, ongoing cost), risk reversal is critical: - "First lesson free" = reduces trial friction - "No payment required today"
children.name: Risk Reversal for Service Businesses

children.docstring: Has: "Your first lesson is free. No payment required today." **Assessment:** Good foundation. Consider: - Is it prominent enough? - Does it appear at
children.name: Current BEAM Risk Reversal

children.docstring: - Removing navigation menu: **+100% conversions** (VWO case study) - Yuppiechef: Navigation removal **doubled** conversions - HubSpot study: **+10%**
children.name: Navigation Menu Impact

children.docstring: - Sticky navigation that keeps user ON the page (section jumps) - When providing exploration is important for the business model - For returning visit
children.name: When Navigation is Acceptable

children.docstring: - Humans rely heavily on first price seen (anchor) - High anchor makes subsequent prices feel like "deals" - Three-tier pricing: users gravitate to mi
children.name: Price Anchoring

children.docstring: When three options presented: - Low option: captures price-sensitive - High option: anchors value - Middle option: becomes "sweet spot"
children.name: Decoy Effect

children.docstring: | Killer | Impact | Fix | |--------|--------|-----| | Slow load (>3s) | 50%+ bounce | Optimize images, minimize JS | | Unclear value prop | 55% leave
children.name: The Fatal Mistakes

children.docstring: - Real constraints (limited spots, seasonal timing) - Special promotions - Product launches
children.name: When to Use

children.docstring: - Fake countdown timers that reset - False scarcity ("Only 2 spots left!" that never changes) - Pressure that creates buyer's remorse
children.name: What to Avoid

children.docstring: **Appropriate urgency:** "Term starts [date]" or "Limited small class sizes" **Inappropriate:** Fake deadlines, manipulative scarcity
children.name: For BEAM

children.docstring: Research shows parents use decision-making heuristics: 1. **One-reason decision** - Focus on single key factor (price, location, reputation) 2. **Imit
children.name: How Parents Choose Tutoring

children.docstring: 1. **Cost** - Is this worth the investment? 2. **Commitment** - What if it doesn't work out? 3. **Quality** - Are these tutors actually qualified? 4.
children.name: Parent Concerns to Address

children.docstring: - 70-90%+ scroll depth = users reaching form - High scroll + low conversion = content engaging but CTA weak - Low scroll (<25%) with low bounce = CTA
children.name: What Scroll Depth Tells You

children.docstring: | Strategy | Impact | |----------|--------| | Remove email confirmation step | Reduces friction | | Don't require credit card (opt-in) | Higher initia
children.name: Trial Signup Best Practices

children.docstring: - Opt-in (no card required): Lower friction, more signups, 15-25% convert - Opt-out (card required): Higher friction, fewer signups, up to 60% convert
children.name: Opt-In vs Opt-Out Trials
